name: ME AND YOUR MIRROR (Afghan hope)
description:
This portrait and several other portraits have been drawn for Afghanistan. This four-part series is a look at the human condition of contemporary Afghanistan. Take a look at being, staying and being able to be. In this collection, according to the painter's view of history and ... in Afghanistan, all portraits are seen as male or without gender.
This portrait is in intertextuality with the story of The Little Match Girl  By: Hans Christian Andersen (1846). Due to the presence of all-out wars in this soil, a green bud has become a symbol of freedom and hope.
Hoping for better days for the people of Afghanistan.

Size:2048*2048
